ratings.comment: The reviews say his slides are poorly organized but I didn't feel that way at all. The exams can be challenging, mostly everything else you're graded on is clearly explained & easy to do & finish. He's smart, accessible & wants his students to succeed. For the project, meet with him several times and you'll be fine. It's easy if you pay attention.

Liad is a nice guy, but he is a horrible professor. The class isn't very challenging or rewarding, it's almost like a worse version of MKT300. You don't learn anything of substance and Liad makes this worse by monotonously reading off the lecture slides. This class made me wish I wasn't a marketing major.

Agree that this class is more of a behavioral psych course which is disappointing. Liad is not that engaging online and his slide layout is difficult to follow. Introduces assignments 3 days before they are due which is frustrating to plan. Calls his exams "quizzes" and they are on the smallest details in the readings/podcasts. Take the other prof.

Liad means well, but he just isn't a good professor. We spent nearly half the class on freshman level psychology/introductory marketing concepts which was confusing because this a capstone course for seniors. He never challenges you to think critically but will cold call on the most random questions. Overall a disappointing last class of my major.

As a capstone course, I did not enjoy MKT460 or Professor Weiss. We spent way too much time on designing a 'nudge' and it felt like this course should be titled more so towards Behavioral Economics or Psychology. His Canvas and slides are poorly designed.
